org.svvrl.goal.core.tran.ltl2buchi
Class LTL2Buchi

java.lang.Object
  org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractAlgorithm
      org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractControllableAlgorithm
          org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractEditableAlgorithm
              org.svvrl.goal.core.tran.AbstractTranslator<LTL,FSA>
                  org.svvrl.goal.core.tran.ltl2buchi.LTL2Buchi
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, Algorithm, AlgorithmListener, ControllableAlgorithm, EditableAlgorithm, Translator<LTL,FSA>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ExtendedLTL2Buchi
public class LTL2Buchi
extends AbstractTranslator<LTL,FSA>

This class provides an implementation of the translation algorithm in [Dimitra Giannakopoulou and Flavio Lerda. From States to Transitions: Improving Translation of LTL Formulae to Büchi Automata. In Formal Techniques for Networked and Distributed Systems (FORTE), LNCS 2529, pages 308-326. Springer, 2002].

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

translate

public FSA translate(LTL formula)
              throws UnsupportedException
This method first simplifies the input formula (if the option is enabled), converts the formula to negation normal form, initializes the NTGBW, initializes the acceptance condition with acceptance sets put in acc_map, and finally invoke expand(LTL) to construct the NTGBW.

Parameters:
formula - a logic formula to be translate
Returns:
the automaton translated from formula
Throws:
UnsupportedException - if formula is not supported by this translator

getEquivalent

protected Node getEquivalent(java.util.Set<Node> nodes,
                             Node node)
Returns a node that is equivalent to a specified node. The returned node is selected from a specified set of nodes. This method will use isEquivalent(Node, Node) to check if two nodes are equivalent.

Parameters:
nodes - a set of nodes
node - a node
Returns:
a node equivalent to node, or null if there is no node in nodes that is equivalent to node

SI

protected boolean SI(LTL f,
                     LTLSet old,
                     LTLSet next)
Returns true is a formula is syntactically implied by a set of formulae. The set of formulae is divided to two sets. One contains formulae to be satisfied in the current state. The other contains formulae to be satisfied in the successors.

Parameters:
f - an LTL formula
old - a set of formulae to be satisfied in the current state
next - a set of formulae to be satisfied in the successors
Returns:
true is a formula is syntactically implied

SI

protected boolean SI(LTLSet set,
                     LTLSet old,
                     LTLSet next)
Returns true if a set of formulae are all syntactically implied by a set of formulae.

Parameters:
set - a set of formulae
old - a set of formulae to be satisfied in the current state
next - a set of formulae to be satisfied in the successors
Returns:
true if the set of formulae are all syntactically implied
See Also:
SI(LTL, LTLSet, LTLSet)

SI

                     Node node)
Returns true if a specified set of LTL formulae are syntactically implied by a node.

Parameters:

Returns:

getTableau

Returns the tableau entries of a specified formula.

Parameters:

Returns:
the tableau entries of the formula

expand

protected void expand(LTL formula)
Expands the formula to be translated. This method is responsible for the creation of all states and transitions of the NTGBW. The acceptance condition should also be filled in this method. Before this method is invoked, the NTGBW #aut is already initialized.

Parameters:
formula - the formula to be translated
